lead_paragraph: The stock holdings of Prime Minister Wen Jiabao’s relatives took a solid jump after Ping An Insurance was granted a waiver to a rule that big financial companies be broken up.
snippet: The stock holdings of Prime Minister Wen Jiabao’s relatives took a solid jump after Ping An Insurance was granted a waiver to a rule that big financial companies be broken up....

headline.print_headline: Lobbying, a Windfall and a Leader’s Family
headline.main: Lobbying, a Windfall and a Leader’s Family

abstract: Greatest source of wealth accumulated by relatives of Chinese Prime Min Wen Jiabao during his leadership has come from shares in once-troubled insurer Ping An Insurance, which were bought after company was granted waiver to rule that big financial companies be broken up; corporate documents and interviews reveal that stakes in company held by Wen's relatives were concealed behind layers of obscure partnerships rather than being held in their names.
